Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on freedom of speech, a fundamental democratic right.
The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are subjective and could lead to a one-size-fits-all approach by the government.
The bill could result in widespread censorship and suppression of free speech due to heavy financial penalties.
There is an imbalance in the bill's protection, favoring government and mainstream media, which can also spread false information.
The legislation is viewed as a means to stifle free exchange of ideas rather than promote it.
Notable Quotes: The Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) Bill 2023 is a direct and utterly reprehensible attack upon that right.

This, coupled with the provision for heavy financial penalties against those who spread information which does not meet the approved standard, can only lead to widespread censorship and a suppression of free speech.
I call on the Prime Minister and his government to dispatch this Bill to its natural home: the nearest available garbage bin.
